title: Gene therapy exempted from GST; duty cuts on critical medicines for cancer and rare diseases expected - The Financial Express
summary:
Gene Therapy Exempted from GST; Duty Cuts on Critical Medicines for Cancer and Rare Diseases Expected

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Financial Express

The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has announced a full exemption of Goods and Service Tax (GST) on gene therapy, which is crucial for treating life-threatening diseases. This exemption is effective immediately.

  • The GST on gene therapy was previously set at 12%.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had announced this exemption last month.
  • The move is expected to significantly impact patients requiring life-saving treatments.
  • Future proposals may include duty cuts for medicines treating cancer and rare diseases in the Union budget 2025.
  • The National Policy for Rare Diseases (NPRD) was introduced to manage various rare diseases comprehensively.
“An New Entry 105A has been inserted in Notification No. 02/2017-Central Tax (Rate) to fully exempt Gene Therapy from GST,” CBIC stated.

This exemption is anticipated to make critical therapies more affordable, alleviating the financial burden on patients.
newTitle: Gene Therapy Exempted from GST; Duty Cuts on Critical Medicines for Cancer and Rare Diseases Expected

summary:
AAP Promises Free Electricity and Water for Tenants in Delhi

Date: Saturday, Publication Source: Times of India

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), led by Arvind Kejriwal, plans to introduce a scheme offering free electricity and water to tenants if victorious in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.

  • Kejriwal emphasizes tenants are part of Delhi’s population and deserve these benefits.
  • The announcement is part of AAP's campaign efforts ahead of elections on February 5.
  • AAP aims for a third consecutive term, focusing on welfare programs.
“Wherever I go, I meet people living on rent who say they benefit from good schools and hospitals but are deprived of free electricity and water schemes,” - Arvind Kejriwal.

The introduction of this scheme aims to address the needs of tenants and enhance AAP's appeal in the forthcoming election.
newTitle: AAP Promises Free Electricity and Water for Tenants in Delhi

title: James Webb Space Telescope Unveils Hidden Interstellar Wonders of Supernova Cassiopeia A - Gadgets 360
summary:
James Webb Space Telescope Unveils Hidden Supernova Cassiopeia A

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Gadgets 360

The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has illuminated the centuries-old supernova Cassiopeia A, revealing intricate structures in the interstellar medium and providing unprecedented insights into the dynamics of interstellar material located 11,000 light-years away.

  • The JWST captured glowing gas and dust from the aftermath of the supernova explosion.
  • Findings were presented at the 245th American Astronomical Society (AAS) conference.
  • The telescope's infrared capabilities revealed complex patterns and three-dimensional structures in interstellar material.
  • The research helps in understanding the processes within dense, dusty regions of space.
“These observations have rapidly advanced the study of the interstellar medium, shedding light on processes that were long considered perplexing.” - Josh Peek

The detailed mapping of Cassiopeia A signifies a major advancement in understanding the physics of the interstellar medium and the role of magnetic fields in star formation.
newTitle: James Webb Space Telescope Unveils Hidden Supernova Cassiopeia A

summary:
Chris Martin and Dakota Johnson Seek Lord Shiva’s Blessings Ahead of Coldplay Concert in Mumbai

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Times of India

In anticipation of Coldplay’s performances in India, Chris Martin and Dakota Johnson visited the Shri Babulnath Temple in Mumbai to seek blessings from Lord Shiva, garnering admiration from fans worldwide.

  • Chris wore a pastel blue kurta and engaged with the local traditions.
  • Dakota donned a modest suit, showing respect for Indian customs.
  • Videos of Dakota whispering a wish to Nandi, Lord Shiva’s bull, went viral.
  • Fans showed overwhelming support for the couple on social media.
  • Coldplay is scheduled to perform three shows in Navi Mumbai and one in Ahmedabad.

Dakota Johnson and Chris Martin (Coldplay) visit Babulnath Mandir to seek blessings before today's concert shows how much he loves India ❤️

— The_Yuvi (@TheYuvi3) January 18, 2025

This visit highlights the couple's deep appreciation for Indian culture and sets a positive tone before their upcoming concerts.

title: 'Some abuse must have happened': Aakash Chopra on BCCI enforcing mandatory travel rules for players - The Times of India
summary:
'Some abuse must have happened': Aakash Chopra on BCCI enforcing mandatory travel rules for players

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Aakash Chopra expresses his surprise regarding the BCCI's decision to enforce mandatory travel rules for players, requiring them to travel with the team for matches and practice sessions, suggesting it is a response to prior misuse.

  • Players can no longer travel separately with their families.
  • The rule was introduced post the review meeting following India's loss to Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Chopra questions the necessity of this new regulation, implying that prior abuses led to its enforcement.
  • Players seeking to travel separately must now obtain permission from both the head coach and the chairman of selectors.
“Players cannot travel separately with families. Some abuse must have happened; that's why this rule is being enforced.” - Aakash Chopra

This new directive has raised questions about accountability and whether it is an overreach in response to isolated incidents.
newTitle: 'Some abuse must have happened': Aakash Chopra on BCCI enforcing mandatory travel rules for players

Tollywood actors N. Balakrishna, Jr NTR and Kalyan Ram paid heartfelt tributes to former Chief Minister N. T. Rama Rao during a ceremony on his 28th death anniversary, reflecting on his contributions as an actor and leader.

  • Tributes were paid at NTR Ghat by family members, including Jr NTR and Kalyan Ram.
  • Balakrishna remarked on NTR's dedication to the welfare of the poor.
  • Minister Nara Lokesh expressed hope that NTR would receive the Bharat Ratna award.
  • NTR was noted for his significant role in launching the Telugu Desam Party (TDP) and his administrative reforms.
“NTR was not only the greatest actor but he dedicated himself to serving people, especially the poor and downtrodden.” - Balakrishna

The event highlighted the lasting influence of N. T. Rama Rao on Andhra Pradesh’s political landscape and the affection held for him by his family and the public.

title: WATCH: Canadian man’s doorbell camera captures audio, video of meteorite crashing Earth - The Indian Express
summary:
WATCH: Canadian man’s doorbell camera captures audio, video of meteorite crashing Earth

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: CBC News

An incredible event unfolded as Joe Velaidum recorded both video and audio of a meteorite crashing to Earth, marking what scientists believe to be the first documentation of such an event.

  • A Canadian man's doorbell camera captured the rare event of a meteorite landing.
  • The meteorite is classified as an ordinary chondrite and is the first recorded from Prince Edward Island.
  • Velaidum had been standing at the impact spot just minutes before the meteorite struck.
  • Experts confirmed the authenticity of the meteorite after initial skepticism from Velaidum's family.
  • This documentation provides new insights into the natural history of Prince Edward Island.
“As far as we know, it’s the first time that a meteorite falling to Earth has been recorded on video, with sound.” - Chris Herd, Geologist

The remarkable capture not only showcases a unique scientific milestone but also deepens our understanding of natural events in this region.
newTitle: Canadian Man Captures Meteorite Crash on Doorbell Camera

title: Dakota Johnson whispers wishes in Nandi's ears as Chris Martin watches her at Mumbai's Shri Babulnath Temple - Hindustan Times
summary:
Dakota Johnson and Chris Martin Visit Mumbai's Shri Babulnath Temple

Date: Jan 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Dakota Johnson and musician Chris Martin were spotted visiting the Shri Babulnath Temple in Mumbai, where Dakota followed a Hindu tradition by whispering wishes to Nandi's statue.

  • Dakota wore a printed black suit and wrapped a dupatta, while Chris opted for a blue kurta and black pants.
  • The couple has been exploring Mumbai as Chris is in the country for Coldplay's tour.
  • In Hindu mythology, Nandi is known as the mount of Lord Shiva, and devotees whisper wishes to him.
  • Coldplay is set to perform in Mumbai on January 18, 19, and 21 as part of their Music of the Spheres World Tour.
“Whispering into Nandi's ear is a Hindu tradition, where devotees pray and make wishes.”

This visit highlights not only Dakota and Chris's relationship but also their engagement with local traditions during their stay in India.
newTitle: Dakota Johnson and Chris Martin Visit Mumbai's Shri Babulnath Temple

title: Ayurveda can provide new hope for Alzheimer's, shows study conducted by Indian scientists - indiablooms
How to glimpse a parade of planets in the January night sky - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
How to Glimpse a Parade of Planets in the January Night Sky

Publication Date: January 2023

Source: AP News

Six planets grace the sky this month in what’s known as a planetary parade, visible to the naked eye. The planets align on one side of the sun, offering a spectacular view for observers.

  1. Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn are visible without special equipment.
  2. Uranus and Neptune require binoculars or telescopes to spot.
  3. The best time for viewing is a few hours after sunset on clear nights.
  4. Venus and Saturn will appear especially close, just two degrees apart.
  5. Stargazing apps may enhance the viewing experience.
“It gives us a little bit better sense of our place in the solar system and the universe.” - Kevin Williams, planetarium director

As planets gradually exit through the spring, this astrological event reminds us of our place in the cosmos.
newTitle: How to Glimpse a Parade of Planets in the January Night Sky
